channel.title: üè¢ University of Toronto on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Toronto on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Cell ontology guided transcriptome foundation model
item.description: scCello: A Cell Ontology-Guided Transcriptome Foundation Model improves single-cell RNA sequencing analysis by incorporating cell lineage information, significantly boosting accuracy and generalizabil…

item.title: Conformal Inverse Optimization
item.description: Conformal inverse optimization learns uncertainty sets for parameters in optimization models, then solves a robust optimization model for high-quality, human-aligned decisions.

item.title: CryoSPIN: Improving Ab-Initio Cryo-EM Reconstruction with Semi-Amortized Pose Inference
item.description: CryoSPIN revolutionizes ab-initio cryo-EM reconstruction with semi-amortized pose inference, achieving faster and more accurate 3D structure determination.

item.title: Diffusion4D: Fast Spatial-temporal Consistent 4D generation via Video Diffusion Models
item.description: Diffusion4D: Fast, consistent 4D content generation via a novel 4D-aware video diffusion model, surpassing existing methods in efficiency and 4D geometry consistency.

item.title: GaussianCut: Interactive segmentation via graph cut for 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: GaussianCut enables intuitive 3D object selection via graph cuts on 3D Gaussian splatting, achieving competitive segmentation without extra training.

item.title: How Molecules Impact Cells: Unlocking Contrastive PhenoMolecular Retrieval
item.description: MolPhenix, a novel multi-modal model, drastically improves zero-shot molecular retrieval by leveraging a pre-trained phenomics model and a novel similarity-aware loss, achieving an 8.1x improvement ov…

item.title: Improved off-policy training of diffusion samplers
item.description: Researchers enhanced diffusion samplers by developing a novel exploration strategy and a unified library, improving sample quality and addressing reproducibility challenges.

item.title: L4GM: Large 4D Gaussian Reconstruction Model
item.description: L4GM: The first 4D model generating high-quality animated 3D objects from single-view videos in a single feed-forward pass.

item.title: Linguistic Collapse: Neural Collapse in (Large) Language Models
item.description: Scaling causal language models reveals a connection between neural collapse properties, model size, and improved generalization, highlighting NC’s broader relevance to LLMs.

item.title: LLM Processes: Numerical Predictive Distributions Conditioned on Natural Language
item.description: LLM Processes leverage LLMs to create probabilistic regression models guided by natural language, enabling seamless integration of expert knowledge and improving prediction accuracy.

item.title: Maia-2: A Unified Model for Human-AI Alignment in Chess
item.description: Maia-2: A unified model for human-AI alignment in chess, coherently captures human play across skill levels, significantly improving AI-human alignment and paving the way for AI-guided teaching.

item.title: Minimum Entropy Coupling with Bottleneck
item.description: A novel lossy compression framework, Minimum Entropy Coupling with Bottleneck (MEC-B), extends existing methods by integrating a bottleneck for controlled stochasticity, enhancing performance in scen…

item.title: Neur2BiLO: Neural Bilevel Optimization
item.description: NEUR2BILO: a neural network-based heuristic solves mixed-integer bilevel optimization problems extremely fast, achieving high-quality solutions for diverse applications.

item.title: Observational Scaling Laws and the Predictability of Langauge Model Performance
item.description: Researchers predict language model performance by observing existing models, bypassing costly training, revealing surprising predictability in complex scaling phenomena.

item.title: On the Efficiency of ERM in Feature Learning
item.description: ERM’s efficiency in feature learning surprisingly remains high even with massive feature maps; its excess risk asymptotically matches an oracle procedure’s, implying potential for streamlined feature-…

item.title: Paths to Equilibrium in Games
item.description: In n-player games, a satisficing path always exists leading from any initial strategy profile to a Nash equilibrium by allowing unsatisfied players to explore suboptimal strategies.

item.title: Policy Aggregation
item.description: This paper introduces efficient algorithms that leverage social choice theory to aggregate multiple individual preferences, resulting in a desirable collective AI policy.

item.title: Quantum Deep Equilibrium Models
item.description: Quantum Deep Equilibrium Models (QDEQs) achieve higher QML performance with shallower circuits by using a DEQ training paradigm, improving near-term quantum computation efficiency.

item.title: Random Cycle Coding: Lossless Compression of Cluster Assignments via Bits-Back Coding
item.description: Random Cycle Coding (RCC) optimally compresses cluster assignments in large datasets, saving up to 70% storage in vector databases by eliminating the need for integer IDs.

item.title: Reward Machines for Deep RL in Noisy and Uncertain Environments
item.description: Deep RL agents can now effectively learn complex tasks even with noisy, uncertain sensor readings by exploiting the structure of Reward Machines.

item.title: RGFN: Synthesizable Molecular Generation Using GFlowNets
item.description: Reaction-GFlowNet (RGFN) revolutionizes small molecule discovery by generating synthesizable molecules directly within the chemical reaction space, dramatically expanding the search space for drug dis…

item.title: SCube: Instant Large-Scale Scene Reconstruction using VoxSplats
item.description: SCube: Instant large-scale 3D scene reconstruction from sparse images using VoxSplats, a novel 3D Gaussian splat representation.

item.title: Self-Consuming Generative Models with Curated Data Provably Optimize Human Preferences
item.description: Curated synthetic data provably optimizes human preferences in iterative generative model training, maximizing expected reward while mitigating variance.

item.title: Sequential Decision Making with Expert Demonstrations under Unobserved Heterogeneity
item.description: ExPerior leverages expert demonstrations to enhance online decision-making, even when experts use hidden contextual information unseen by the learner.

item.title: Sequential Probability Assignment with Contexts: Minimax Regret, Contextual Shtarkov Sums, and Contextual Normalized Maximum Likelihood
item.description: This paper introduces contextual Shtarkov sums, a new complexity measure characterizing minimax regret in sequential probability assignment with contexts, and derives the minimax optimal algorithm, co…

item.title: Simplifying Constraint Inference with Inverse Reinforcement Learning
item.description: This paper simplifies constraint inference in reinforcement learning, demonstrating that standard inverse RL methods can effectively infer constraints from expert data, surpassing complex, previously …

item.title: Temporal-Difference Learning Using Distributed Error Signals
item.description: Artificial Dopamine (AD) algorithm achieves comparable performance to backpropagation methods in complex RL tasks by using only synchronously distributed per-layer TD errors, demonstrating the suffici…

item.title: Your contrastive learning problem is secretly a distribution alignment problem
item.description: Contrastive learning is reframed as a distribution alignment problem, leading to a flexible framework (GCA) that improves representation learning with unbalanced optimal transport.
